utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I’m sorry I’m late, did I miss anything?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Joey stuffing 15 Oreos in his mouth.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: 15? Your personal best!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Where were you?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, on a date. Yeah, I met this girl on the train going to a museum upstate.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, yeah! How did you meet her?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, which museum?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, answer his.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, it was just me and her at the back of the train, and I sat near the door, so she’d have to pass by me if she wanted to switch cars. She was totally at my mercy.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Were you so late because you were burring this woman?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, I’m getting back down ‘cause she lives in Poughkeepsie. She seems really great, but she’s like totally great, but she lives two and a half hours away.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: How can she be great if she’s from Poughkeepsie? That joke would’ve killed in Albany.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Done! I did it! Heh, who’s stupid now?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, look at this! They’re lighting the big Christmas tree tonight.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Umm, that paper’s two weeks old.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right, who keeps leaving old newspapers in the trash?! I really wanted to take Kathy to this, I can’t believe I missed it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey, y’know, at least you have somebody to miss that stuff with! I hate being alone this time of year! Next thing you know it’ll be Valentine’s Day, then my birthday, then bang!—before you know it, they’re lighting that damn tree again. Ohh, I want somebody! Y’know, I want a man!! I mean, it doesn’t even have to be a big relationship, y’know, just like a fling would be great.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Really?! I didn’t think girls ever just wanted a fling.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, believe me, it’s been a long time since I’ve been flung.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, I know what I’m giving you for Christmas.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y’know what? There’s some nice guys at my office, do you want me to set you up?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah! Wait a minute, it’s been a long time that I’ve been single. How come you never offered this before?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I have a girlfriend, I’m-I’m happy. So, I no longer feel the need to go out of my way to stop others from being happy.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay! No accountants. Oh, and no one from like legal. I don’t like guys with boring jobs.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh and Ross was like what? A lion tamer?

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What’s wrong Mon?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ohh, everybody at the restaurant still hates me.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I thought I was making headway, everyone was smiling at me all day, I get off work and I find out that they wrote this on my chef’s hat.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey, maybe they meant to write, ‘Quiet, bitch.’

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey, honey! What’s the matter? Fine, I was just trying to be nice! Whoa!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I mean I have not been picked on this much since kindergarten and they had to bring in someone from junior high to do the see-saw with me.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ohhh!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I mean they’re trying to do everything they can to make me quit, and if there were any other job, I would. But this is something I’ve been waiting for my whole life.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, wait a minute, you’re the boss! Why don’t you just yell at them? Or, fire them?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I would love too, but I can’t! I mean I just can’t, you know that I’m not good at confrontation.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, you know what you can do? I remember reading about this director, I think it was Orson Wells, who at the beginning of the movie would hire somebody, just so he could fire them in front of everybody. Then they would all know, who’s boss.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, Mon! I’m not doing anything, why don’t you fire me?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That’s a good idea! Wait, do you know how to waiter?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Good enough to get fired.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right, you’re hired!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! That must be why I got fired last week! Does this Orson Wells guy direct Burger King commercials?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I say, Drew! Are you seeing anybody right now? Og-ee-op, I’m not asking for me, I’m… I mean… No, I’m-I’m not gay, I’m not asking you out. I’m not-I’m not-I’m not gay!

utterance.speaker: Drew
utterance.content: I didn’t think you were gay. I do now.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: See my friend-my friend, Rachel, she wants to be set up.

utterance.speaker: Drew
utterance.content: Ahh, I just got out of a big relationship, I’m not looking for any thing serious.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, y’know what, that might be okay even if it was just kind of a fling, that might be all right with Rachel.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa! Is this, hot Rachel, that you took to the Christmas party, Rachel?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, by the way, that is her full name.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Oh wow! I’m free for her!

utterance.speaker: Drew
utterance.content: Oh, wait a second! I didn’t say I wasn’t free!

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Hey, Chandler, why don’t we talk this over at the Ranger game tomorrow?

utterance.speaker: Drew
utterance.content: Hold on, y’know I just got a box of Cubans, maybe I bring them by your office around uh, five?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh well, that’s uh, a little later than I uh, generally care to stay, but sure!

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Maybe, before the game we could enjoy some eight year old some small batch Basel Hadens.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I don’t really know what that is, but let’s!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey! You guys, I’m writing a holiday song for everyone. Do you want to hear it?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Happy Chanukah, Monica! May your Christmas be snowy, Joey! Happy New Year, Chandler and Ross. Spin the draddle, Rachel!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Pheebs, that’s great!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, yay!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: But y’know umm, Rachel doesn’t rhyme with draddle.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I know but it’s so hard! Nothing rhymes with your stupid name!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What are you talking about? Lots of things rhyme with Rachel. Bagel. Mail. Jail. Bail. Able. May-pole.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: All good, thanks. Do you maybe have a nickname have like a nickname that’s easier to rhyme?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Didn’t your dad used to call you Pumpkin?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh yeah!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Pumpkin? Yeah. But did he ever call you like, Budolph?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hello, children!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Have I got the 50 guys for you!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh yeah, I just showed this a picture of you and guys were throwing themselves at me! They’re buying me drinks! They’re giving me stuff! Knicks tonight?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Sure! Where are the seats?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Wherever! I’ve got like 20!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So, will I like any of these guys?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y’know what, I’m gonna uh, play the field just a little more.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Chandler!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Guys are signing over their 401-K’s to me?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You work with robots!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes. Okay, there’s this one guy, Patrick, I think you’re gonna like him, he’s really nice, he’s funny, he’s a swimmer.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh, I like swimmer’s bodies!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, and his father invented that magnetic strip on the back of credit cards.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Op, I like credit cards!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: See, I’m not bad at this fixing up thing, huh?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, so what does he do?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, he works in the Fine Foods division.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Your company has a fine foods division?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It’s a big company, I don’t—if you—I…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Now, wait a second! You make food and robots?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No! No, the robots just work for them.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right, I’m gonna go to work. Does anybody have a problem with that?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, lady, I do! I got a problem with that!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You want a problem? I’ll give you a problem!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, what are you gonna do? You’re gonna fire me?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You bet your ass, I’m gonna fire you! Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, wow! I should get going. I-I got a date tonight.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh yeah! With who?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You know that girl I told you about who lives up in Poughkeepsie?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Not her. Yeah, this is someone else I meet, and I-I can’t decide between the two of them. Y’know the one from Poughkeepsie, even though she’s a two hour train ride away, is really pretty, really smart, and-and a lot of fun. But this other girl, well, she lives right uptown. Y’know she’s, well she’s-she’s just as pretty, I guess she’s smart, she’s not fun.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: If she’s no fun, why do you want to date her at all?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, I-I want to give her another chance, y’know? She lives so close. And, at the end of the date, the other time, she-she said something that was—if she was kidding was very funny. On the other hand, if she wasn’t kidding, she’s not fun, she’s stupid, and kind of a racist.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, man!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey! Ooh, how was your first day working at the restaurant?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Damn!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, what happened to your fancy chef’s jacket?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: They baked it. I can’t take this anymore. I’m gonna call a meeting tonight, I’m gonna fire you tonight.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You got it! Oh-oh!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What are you doing?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: It’s still a tiny bit on fire there.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Thanks. I think you got it!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Chandler!! You have the best taste in men!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, like father, like son.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Patrick and I had such a great time last night! I mean I think this could maybe turn into something serious.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Really?! I-I thought you weren’t looking for something serious? I thought you were looking for some kind of a fling.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, y'know, possibly. You didn’t tell him that, though? Right?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ummmmmmmm, no.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You told this guy that I was looking for a fling?! You don’t tell the guy that!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Why not?! I’d be thrilled if I heard that some hot girl was just looking to get—oh I see.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, between you telling him that I wanted to have a fling and me putting out on the first date—oh, he’s so gonna get the wrong idea.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, Joey, could you pass the cheese?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah. Listen uh, I’d prefer it if you didn’t call me Joey. Since I don’t know anyone here, I thought it’d be cool to try out a cool work nickname.

utterance.speaker: A Waiter
utterance.content: Hey, dragon! Here’s your tips from Monday and Tuesday.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: There’s like-there’s like 300 bucks in this one!

utterance.speaker: The Waiter
utterance.content: Yeah, people get pretty generous around the holidays. And it never hurts to wear tight trousers.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay. Could the waiters gather around to hear tonight’s specials? Okay, first there is a Chilean Sea Bass prepared with a Mango relish on a bag—Why is nobody writing these down?

utterance.speaker: The Waiter
utterance.content: Because we can remember them.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Because your all gonna make up fake specials and make me cook them like you did the other night?

utterance.speaker: The Waiter
utterance.content: Well, sure, that too.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, forget the specials for a minute. Umm, all right here’s the thing, for the last two weeks I have umm, tried really hard to create a positive atmosphere…

utterance.speaker: The Waiter
utterance.content: Can’t hear you!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: A positive atmosphere! But I-I-I have had it up to here. From now on, it is gonna be my way, or the highway! All right? Does anybody have a problem with that?!! Hey new guy! I said, does anybody have a problem with that?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No ma’am.

utterance.speaker: The Waiter
utterance.content: Hey! He has a name, it’s Dragon. Do you wanna know your name? Check your hat. We did the hat right?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What the hell happened?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I am so-so-so sorry. I was gonna do it! Really! But I was standing there with 327 dollars in one hand and 238 dollars in the other hand, and I was thinking, "Wow! It’s been a long time since I had… 327 + 238 dollars!"

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Joey, we had a deal. That-that’s why you’re here! I’ve got to fire you!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: And I gotta pay rent! Look, how-how about this? You don’t fire me, instead I stay here, I gain their trust, and they’ll start listening to all the nice things I’ve been saying about you.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What kinda things have you been saying?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well nothing yet, they really hate you and I want to fit in.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Happy, happy Chanukah, Chandler and Monica. Very merry…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, y’know, y’know what Pheebs?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m not Jewish, so…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So! Ross doesn’t really decorate his tree with floss, but you don’t hear him complaining do you? God!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Bad dream?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I wasn’t sleeping.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh yeah, then uh, what was Phoebe’s song about?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: The one with the cat. I gotta go, I’ve got another date.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So, did you pick one yet?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, it turns out that the one from uptown was making a joke. But it was a different joke than I thought—it wasn’t that funny. So I’m still torn.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well look, you don’t really like the one from uptown and you’re too exhausted from dating the one up in Poughkeepsie, so I say you just end them both. Okay? You take a train up to Poughkeepsie and break up with her, and on your way back you break up with uptown. And then by the time you get home tonight, you’re done!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Y’know, you’re right. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Umm, well I had a similar problem when I lived in Prague.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Prague?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: There’s sooo much you don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Chandler! Patrick just uh, ended things with me. Did you or did you not tell him that I was looking for a serious relationship?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I did! I absolutely did!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You idiot!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m sure you’re right, but why?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You don’t tell a guy that you’re looking for a serious relationship! You don’t tell the guy that! Now you scared him away!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, man. I’m sorry, I’m so-so sorry.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Y’know, you should never be allowed to talk to people!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I know! I know!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh! See just I’m right back where I started! Aww, this sucks! Being alone, sucks!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, y’know, you’re-you’re gonna meet somebody! You’re a great catch! Y’know when I was telling all those guys about you, I didn’t have to lie once.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah! You graduated Magma Ku Laude, right?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, it doesn’t matter. Hey, y’know what, I’ve got two tickets to tonight’s Rangers game, you wanna come with me?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Cute guys in little shorts? Sure.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, actually it’s a hockey team, so it’s angry Canadians with no teeth.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well that sounds fun too.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Have you ever been with a woman?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?! Chandler, what is the matter with you?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So there is no good time to ask that question.

utterance.speaker: The Conductor
utterance.content: The next station is Poughkeepsie. Poughkeepsie!

utterance.speaker: The Woman From Poughkeepsie
utterance.content: Ross? Ross! Wake up! Ross! Ross! Ross!! Ross!!! Ross!!!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I need more swordfish. Can you get me some more swordfish?

utterance.speaker: Kitchen Worker
utterance.content: I don’t speak English.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You did a minute ago!

utterance.speaker: Kitchen Worker
utterance.content: Well, I don’t know what to tell ya!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Fine!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay! Very funny! Somebody let me out please?! Come on, I’m cold! And covered in marinara sauce! Come on! Let me out!

utterance.speaker: The Waiter
utterance.content: You found that handle, did ya?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That’s not funny.

utterance.speaker: The Waiter
utterance.content: Well that’s not true.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’m a good person. And I’m a good chef, and I don’t deserve to have marinara sauce all over me! Y’know what, if you want me to quit this bad, then all you have to do is…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! Chef Geller! Y’know that little speech you made the other day? Well I got a problem with it!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You do?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You bet I do! I just ah, wasn’t listening then, that’s all.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well if you want a problem? I’ll give you a problem!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What are you gonna do? You’re gonna fire me?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You bet your ass I’m gonna fire you! Get out of my kitchen! Get out!! All right! Anybody else got a problem? How ‘bout you Chuckles? You think this is funny now?

utterance.speaker: The Waiter
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How about if I dance around all covered in sauce? Huh? You think it’s funny now?

utterance.speaker: The Waiter
utterance.content: No, it’s really good.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Good! Now, take those salads to table 4, And you! Get the swordfish! And you! Get a haircut!

utterance.speaker: The Conductor
utterance.content: Last stop, Montreal. This stop is Montreal.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Woman On Train
utterance.content: I made a bet with myself that you have beautiful eyes. Now that I see them, I win.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Woman On Train
utterance.content: We’re at my stop. But would you like to have coffee?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Are we really in Montreal?!

utterance.speaker: Woman On Train
utterance.content: Yes we are. So, coffee?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Coffee sounds great. Wait, so, so you live in Montreal?

utterance.speaker: Woman On Train
utterance.content: Oh, no. But it’s just a two hour ferry ride to Nova Scotia.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well I guess I should’ve thought about my wife and kids before I talked back to chef Geller!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yep! Looks like it’s gonna be a leeeeean Christmas at the Dragon house this year.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Enough!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Lean-lean-lean!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: "Went to the store, sat on Santa's lap.
